page.title: 03HOW THEY'VE CHANGED (1)
page.content: In 1911 the Clease Hall(2) was being built. In that time the old Clease Hall was in use as a school building. The school would hold only about 100 children. In the school, you started at 5 and left at 14. In about 1906 farming was done mostly with horses. They used the horses for sheaving and cutting the grass. They used a horse sweep,but before that,they carried the corn in wagons. Farm barns were then called mohays. The animals had to be driven by hand to the market or elsewhere. Camelford had its own band and used to play in the Camelford Show. Sportsmans used to be the work-house. The Museum used to be the animal pound and where animals were bought and sold on market day.
